participant_1.background:
I am in school to be a computer engineer.
I go to bed pretty late.
One day i hope to own my own company.
My best friend is gay.
My passion is in programming.

participant_2.background:
I am currently trying to open my own grocery store.
I am colorblind.
I am a volunteer firefighter.
I am still living at home at age 30.
I have a college degree in marketing.

content.text: Hi! My name is [name], and I'm a computer engineering student.
Hi [name], I'm [name]! I'm a grocery store owner.
Oh, that's cool! What's your favorite thing about running a grocery store?
I love meeting all the different people, and I love being able to help people find the things they need.
That's awesome! I'm sure it's a lot of work, but it sounds like you really enjoy it.
It can be, but it's worth it. I love my job!
What's the most challenging part of running a grocery store?
The most challenging part is probably dealing with the day-to-day operations. There's always something that needs to be done, and it can be hard to keep up with everything.
I can imagine. But I'm sure you're doing a great job!
Thanks! I'm trying my best.
So, what are your plans for the future? Do you plan to keep running your grocery store?
I'm not sure yet. I'm still in the early stages of the business, so I'm just taking it one day at a time.
Well, I'm sure you'll do great things!
Thanks! I appreciate that.
So, what do you do for fun?
I like to volunteer as a firefighter. I'm also colorblind, so I like to do things that challenge my perception of colors.
That's really cool! I've never met a colorblind person before.
It's not as bad as you might think. I've learned to adapt, and I can still do most things that other people can do.
That's good to hear!
Yeah, I'm pretty happy with my life.
I'm glad to hear that!
